newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: MRCB to sell stake in cable making unit.
newsitem.headline: MRCB to sell stake in cable making unit.

text.p: Conglomerate Malaysian Resources Corp Bhd (MRCB) has agreed to sell an 80 percent stake in its wholly-owned cable manufacturing subsidiary, Gunung Petaling Sdn Bhd, for 13.52 million ringgit cash.
The stake will be sold to private investment firm, Bidalan Ria Sdn Bhd.
MRCB said in a statement on Saturday that the disposal of 10.4 million shares in Gunung Petaling at 1.30 ringgit per share followed the management buy-out by MRCB and Gunung Petaling.
In June 1994, Gunung Petaling was awarded a five-year contract of 141.6 million ringgit by Telekom Malaysia Bhd for the supply of copper telecommunication cables.

Meanwhile, MRCB, in a separate statement, said group managing director Abu Bakar Abdul Karim had resigned from the company. Abu Bakar is one of the three senior management of MRCB who is involved in the management buy-out of Gunung Petaling.
The other two directors and shareholders of Bidalan Ria, the vehicle for the management buy-out of Gunung Petaling, are Ali Ariffin and Harun Hashim.
